isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - FE 300, RE 200, RE 300 - FE 300 CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: Check fuse F7 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F7 and circuit A12, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A12, then repair. Install fuse.
Disconnect air dryer/ drain valve connector (40). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A39A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A39A or dash conn. (2), then repair.
At (40) measure voltage across circuit A39A to K39-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit K39-GA/ K11-GJ, then repair.
Reconnect connector (40) and disconnect air dryer connector (94). Turn key on and measure voltage from black wire to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in black wire or conn. (51) or (76), then repair.
At connector (94), measure voltage across black wire to white wire.
Locate open or poor connection in white wire or conn. (51) or (76), then repair.
At (94), install jumper from black wire to heater element feed. With key on and unit cooled to below 50°F (10°C), measure voltage from element ground terminal to white wire.
Remove jumper wire and reconnect connector (94). Air dryer circuitry checks good.
Check fuse F8 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F8 and circuit A12, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A12, then repair. Install fuse.
Disconnect air dryer/ drain valve connector (40). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A39 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A39 or dash conn. (2), then repair.
At (40) measure voltage across circuit A39 to K39-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit K39-GA/ K11-GJ, then repair.
Reconnect connector (40) and disconnect drain valve pigtail. Turn key on and measure voltage from black wire to ground.
Drain valve conn., black wire to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in black wire, then repair.
Disconnect white wire. At connector, measure voltage across black wire to white wire.
Drain valve conn., black wire to white wire.
Locate open or poor connection in white wire, then repair.
Reconnect white ground wire to drain valve. With key on and unit cooled to below 50°F (10°C), measure voltage from black wire to valve pigtail.
Drain valve pigtail to black wire.
Reconnect pigtail connector. Drain valve circuitry checks good.
Does the water-in-fuel system operate properly?
Does the heated fuel filter work properly?
Remove fuel heater relay (R5). At relay connector, measure voltage from cavity E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A19H, or open fuse F17, then repair.
At relay connector, measure voltage from cavity B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A19D, or open fuse F20, then repair.
At relay socket (R5), measure voltage from cavity B to cavity A.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A11-GA, then repair.
Bench test fuel filter relay (R5) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Apply +12V to relay pin 86 and ground to pin 85. Measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Reconnect relay (R5) and disconnect green wire from fuel filter. Turn key on and measure voltage from green wire to ground.
Fuel filter, green wire to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A19A, dash conn. (2), circuit K19A, conn. (6706) or green wire, then repair.
At fuel filter, remove brown wire and measure voltage across green wire to brown wire.
Fuel filter, from green to brown wire.
Locate open or poor connection in brown wire or circuit A19-GD/ A11-GJ, then repair.
Reconnect brown wire. With the fuel heater cooled to below 50°F (10°C), measure voltage from the green wire to the heater power stud.
Fuel filter, green wire to heater power stud.
Reconnect green wire. Heated fuel filter system checks good.
Repair or replace heated fuel filter.
Disconnect water-in-fuel module (16). Turn key on and at connector, measure voltage from circuit A19E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A19E, then repair.
At socket (16), measure voltage across circuit A19E to A19-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A19-GB, or key switch, then repair.
At socket (16), install jumper from circuit A19E to A19F. Does warning light operate?
Disconnect WIF warning light conn. (9) and at circuit A19F, measure voltage to ground
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A19F, then repair.
At WIF connector (9), measure voltage across circuit A19F to A19-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A19-G/ A11-G, then repair.
At WIF connector (16) move jumper across circuit A19E to A19A. At the filter, disconnect yellow wire from the water probe. Turn key on and measure voltage from yellow wire to ground.
Water probe conn., yellow wire to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A19A, dash conn. (2), circuit A19A, conn. (6706), or yellow wire, then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect WIF module (16). At water probe connector, jumper yellow wire to ground. Does light work?
Water probe conn., jumper yellow wire to gnd.
Remove water probe and install jumper from the probe to ground. Measure voltage from yellow wire to water probe feed stud.
Water probe, yellow wire to probe feed stud.
Install probe and connections. WIF system checks good.
Remove pump control relay (85) and measure voltage from circuit A90 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in fusible link A90-FL or circuit A90, then repair.
Disconnect reserve pump motor connector. Install a jumper wire at relay socket (85) from circuit A90 to A90S. At pump motor connector, measure voltage from circuit 90S to ground.
Pump motor conn., A90S to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90S or conn. (84) or (88), then repair.
Reconnect circuit A90S to pump motor terminal. Does motor run?
Remove jumper. Go to next step.
Bench test relay (85) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay by applying +12 volts to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Remove fuse F1 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F1 and circuit A90A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90A, then repair. Re-install fuse.
Disconnect connectors (92) and (93) from brake switch (209). At (92) measure voltage from circuit A90B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90B, or conn. (83), (87) or (92), then repair.
Measure resistance across switch (209) from BK3 to BK2 and BK3 to BK1 while brake pedal is depressed.
(209), across BK3 to BK2, and BK3 to BK1.
Reconnect (92) and (93) to brake switch (209). Remove blocking diode from connector (81). With pedal depressed, measure voltage from circuit A90G to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90G or conn. (92), (87) or (83), then repair.
At (81), and with brake pedal depressed, measure voltage from A70C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A70C or conn. (93), (87) or (83), then repair.
With multimeter in diode test mode, test diode (81). Does diode test good?
Re-install diode (81). Remove fuse F2 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F2, measure voltage from circuit A90U to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90U or A13A, then repair. Install fuse.
Remove diode from connector (80). Turn key on and at (80), measure voltage from circuit A90T to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90T, then repair.
With brake pedal depressed and at (80), measure voltage from circuit A70D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A70D, then repair.
With multimeter in diode test mode, test diode (80). Does diode test good?
Install diode. Go to next step.
Disconnect monitor module connector (86). With brake pedal depressed, measure voltage from circuit A90C to ground and A90D to ground.
(86), A90C to gnd., A90D to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90C and/or A90D, then repair.
At 86, measure voltage from circuit A90H to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90H, then repair.
At (86), measure resistance from circuit A11-GD to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A11-GD/ A11-GA, then repair.
At pump control relay socket (85), measure voltage from circuit A90J to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90J, then repair.
At (85), install jumper wire between circuit A90J and A90E. Turn key on and at connector (86), measure voltage from circuit A90L to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90E or A90L, then repair.
Remove jumper and re-install relay (85). Turn key on and at (86), measure voltage from circuit A90Q to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90Q or conn. (84) or (88), then repair.
At (86), measure voltage from circuit A90M to ground. Did alarm and warning light operate?
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90M, alarm (R1), circuit A90N, or the circuit board, then repair.
Disconnect flow switch connector and measure resistance from switch terminal to ground.
Reconnect flow switch connector and disconnect differential pressure switch connector (91). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A90K to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90K, or conn. (84) or (88), then repair.
At (91), measure voltage across circuit A90K to circuit A90L.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A90L, then repair.
Hydraulic brake pump motor circuitry checks good. Re-install monitor module (86) and apply brakes. Does motor operate?
With brake pedal released, turn key to on position. Does pump motor operate?

para.emph: This procedure checks for proper operation of the circuitry to the body builder connector.

entry.para: With brake pedal depressed, does hydraulic reserve pump motor operate?
First perform previous test: Hydraulic Brake System Circuitry.
Remove brake monitor module (86) and with brakes applied, measure voltage from circuit A90C to ground.
Remove connector (93) from brake switch (209). With brakes applied, measure voltage from switch circuit BK1 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit BK1, then repair.
Reconnect (93) and remove blocking diode connector (81). With brakes applied, measure voltage from circuit A70C to ground.
Repair open in circuit 90C and connect (86) and (81).
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A70C or conn. (93), (87), or (83), then repair. Reconnect conn. (86) and block diode (81).
Check fuse F12 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition and repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F12, measure voltage from circuit A14A to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A14A, then repair. Install fuse.
Remove stop light relay (R4) from fuse panel socket. At socket, measure voltage from cavity D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A70B, then repair.
With brakes applied and at socket (R4), measure voltage from cavity B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits A70E, A70D or diode (81), then repair.
At socket (R4), measure resistance from cavity A to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A70-G/ A11-GA, then repair.
Bench test relay (R4) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay by applying +12 volts to pin 85 and ground to pin 86. Measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Install relay (R4) and disconnect body builder connector (169). With brake applied and at cavity A, measure voltage from circuit A70A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A70A, then repair. Reconnect (169).

para.emph: This procedure checks for proper operation of the circuitry to the body builder connector.

entry.para: Check fuse F12 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition and repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F12, measure voltage from circuit A14A/A14 to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A14A/A14, then repair. Install fuse.
At stop light switch, remove jumper harness connector coming from platform harness. At connector, measure voltage from red wire to ground.
1st stop light sw. conn., red wire to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in red wire, conn. (26), or circuit A70, then repair.
Remove harness connector from other switch. At connector, measure voltage from red wire to ground.
2nd stop light sw. conn., red wire to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in red wire, then repair.
Measure resistance of brown wire between switch connectors.
Locate open or poor connection in brown wire, then repair.
With brakes applied, measure resistance across terminal leads of each switch (N/L).
Reconnect stop light switch connectors and disconnect body builder connector (169). With brakes applied and at (169), measure voltage from circuit A70A to ground.
Stop light switch circuitry to (169) checks good.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A70A, circuit A70B, conn. (26) or the brown wire, then repair.
